summary: ew comparing sansa smiling after killing ramsey to daenerys smiling after burning kings landing is disgusting. sansa smiled...
question: ew comparing sansa smiling after killing ramsey to daenerys smiling after burning kings landing is disgusting. sansa smiled after killing a man who raped her and physically and emotionally tortured her. daenerys smiled after burning innocent men, women, and children alive. (although just to clarify I have absolutely no issue with dany killing viserys because he was her abuser) i’ve also seen people try to compare sansa and arya killing littlefinger to daenerys burning kings landing. which wtf.
answer:
I agree with you! As I’ve said before, I have zero problem with Dany celebrating Viserys’ dying since he physically, emotionally, and sexually abused her. And even in the show, I interpreted her reaction as her compartmentalizing her feelings and trying to not show emotion rather than her reveling in his painful death. Plus, in the show, since she’s older, Dany (rightfully) states that she’s been sold and raped and abused but in the books, she’s so young that after their deaths, even though Viserys and Drogo treated her horrifically, she romanticizes them to the point she names her dragons after them as well as her (shitty) brother Rhaegar. 

But yeah, I saw the criticism about Sansa and Arya killing Littlefinger and I was like…. the dude was the reason their father was MURDERED, he killed their aunt, and started the War of the Five Kings, all because he was in love with their mother! In the show, he sold Sansa to Ramsay and although he sold Jeyne Poole to the Boltons in the books, book!Sansa will not be happy when she finds that out and I hope that she’s the reason book!Littlefinger dies as well. He deserved to die and the fact that Arya slit his throat was probably the most humane way to do it since he died quickly. Plus, another difference between them executing Littlefinger and Dany burning King’s Landing is that Littlefinger is one man who was the reason for so much suffering, not hundreds of thousands of civilians.

tags: i cant stop thinking about this
summary: Unseen Scene from S8 of GoT
body:
Unseen Scene from S8 of GoT

Arya, sailing off: …

Gendry, running after her: Arya!

Arya: Go back, Gendry! I’m going alone!

Gendry, flailing into the water: Of course you are! And I’m coming with you!

Arya: You can’t swim!

Gendry: *proceeds to fucking drown before Arya saves him*

tags: ser gendry of the hollow hill
summary: Do you think book gendrya will be endgame?
question: Do you think book gendrya will be endgame?
answer:
I think we have a strong case for Gendrya in the end. There are some very deliberate scenes in the books from an author who thrives on the intricacies involved in long-term set up and eventual payoff. From the obvious:

  • Arya’s “blacksmith hands”
  • Gendry’s jealousy of Ned Dayne
  • Arya feeling hurt and throwing back the comment about him ringing Bella’s bells. (The actual “No one” meme tbh)
  • Their closeness was enough to make the guys in the Brotherhood take note, causing Lem to have a word with Gendry
  • Not to mention Tom winking at Arya during “My Feather Bed”

But one of my very favourite pro-Gendrya arguments is the fact they both have so many attributes that are similar to Robert and Lyanna yet George actively showed them correcting the mistakes that undid them. Gendry turning down Bella is a huge neon sign that he is not his father, and in this he has taken away the thing that Lyanna found so disconcerting about Robert. He also ensured that Gendry saw “the iron underneath” in Arya before the beauty giving every part of that subversion its own moment, ending with some very deliberate scenes at Acorn Hall.

I also truly believe Arya has a bigger ending in store; one that mirrors Queen Nymeria’s story more (he’s set her up too perfectly to be a Warrior Queen with a fair and prosperous reign) and in doing so she will choose who she has by her side. Gendry also has a bigger part yet to play and is currently defending orphans and staying true to his own moral code by using that Baratheon stubbornness for good, showing more Orys than his father. And who did Orys wed in the end? His own Warrior Queen 😉

tags: i hate tywin but i respect him
summary:
..... "-And what do they say of Robb Stark in the North?
- They call him the Young Wolf.
- And?
- They say he rides into battle...
body:
….. “-And what do they say of Robb Stark in the North?

- They call him the Young Wolf.

- And?

- They say he rides into battle on the back of a giant direwolf. They say he can turn into a wolf himself when he wants. They say he can’t be killed.

-And do you believe them?

-No, my lord. Anyone can be killed.”

GAME OF THRONES-S2E5

summary: I can’t believe that people are still justifying how horrible child!Sansa was and how much that hurt Arya and made her feel...
body:
I can’t believe that people are still justifying how horrible child!Sansa was and how much that hurt Arya and made her feel inadequate;by saying “yEAh buT aRya Pulled PRanKs oN hER tOo”Right,pranks;Sansa would straight up go and insult her..nonetheless being the total opposite Arya would ve liked nothing more than to get along with her too.She answered because the other choice was giving up and showing how horrible that made her feel….

How about we focus on the fact that at the end of the series they’re the ones who understand each other the most?How about we focus on the fact that once they found each other again they were the ones who mostly warmed up to each othere right away?Siblings who didn’t get along as children often get each other the best as adults. I don’t wanna see no old grudge resurfacing in this fandom.

Please have more appreciation for their relationship.

Anglophiles are beloved here. #Ancientandforever

summary: I’ve been thinking about how they contrasted Daenerys and Arya in season 8 - Arya doesn’t like the praise and cheers of being...
body:
I’ve been thinking about how they contrasted Daenerys and Arya in season 8

- Arya doesn’t like the praise and cheers of being called a hero while Daenerys craves the adulation of the people.

- Arya becomes more human and less attached to vengeance the more she is around people she loves. Daenerys becomes more inhuman and vengeful as each person she loves is taken away.

- Arya’s epiphany of choosing life with her white horse is contrasted with Daenerys choosing death on her black dragon.

And I get increasingly angry that Arya ended up alone. What the hell was that about?

summary: I’m always going to be mad that everyone saw Arya being a badass assassin except for Jon. And we didn’t even get a scene of his...
body: I’m always going to be mad that everyone saw Arya being a badass assassin except for Jon. And we didn’t even get a scene of his genuine reaction to her killing the Night King.

reblog.comment: I’m always going to be mad that everyone saw Arya being a badass assassin except for Jon. And we didn’t even get a scene of his genuine reaction to her killing the Night King.

blog.name: thekubertschool
blog.title: The Kubert School
blog.description: For the past 35+ years, we are the only school that specializes in the field of Cartoon-Graphics. We train students to be professional cartoonists, and/or commercial artists, and illustrators. In addition, our school is very unique compared to other art schools because we were founded and are run by cartoonists. All of our faculty are professional commercial artists -- cartoonists, illustrators, animators, and designers. We have produced hundreds of students who have gone on to become professionals in the comic book industry. Visit us at http://www.kubertschool.edu

summary: But I'm afraid when I hear stories About a husband and wife There's no happy endings No Henry Lee But you are the greatest thing...

But I’m afraid when I hear stories
About a husband and wife
There’s no happy endings
No Henry Lee
But you are the greatest thing about me

summary: George RR Martin gave us not one but THREE badass women warriors (Arya, Brienne, and Asha) none of whom are stereotypes and all...
body: George RR Martin gave us not one but THREE badass women warriors (Arya, Brienne, and Asha) none of whom are stereotypes and all which have completely different yet equally compelling personalities, motivations, and backstories and it’s fucking amazing

blog.description: IT HAS (apparently lost wind) SET SAIL

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary:
THIS IS EVERYTHING. From a Swedish interview with Joseph Dempsie.
Translation of the first question + Joe's answer:
No problem!...
body:
THIS IS EVERYTHING. From a Swedish interview with Joseph Dempsie.

Translation of the first question + Joe’s answer:

No problem! [Joe was late for the interview]. I fully understand that you had to wait for Arya to park the boat so you could jump off.

Hahaha, yeah that’s exactly how it was!

IT’S CANON OKAY!!!! HE IS ON THAT BOAT.

blog.name: mladyandthebastard
blog.title: M'Lady And The Bastard
blog.description:
This blog is dedicated to Arya Stark and Gendry (Waters) from the HBO show Game of Thrones and the book series A Song of Ice and Fire. 
Old blog: Miladyandthebastard

summary: Wanna know what I'm mad about?
body:
Wanna know what I’m mad about?

How the fuck did we not get a scene where everyone found out about Gendry and Arya knowing each other? About Gendry protecting Arya. A scene where no one saw the flirting or sexual tension or commented on them having sex! Like the fuck?
